headline: Greta: My terrifying elevator ride in Vietnam
subHeadline: Greta's 'Off the Record' commentary, 1/26/15: I learned one lesson big time during my recent trip: Don't ride Russian-made elevators in a Communist country. There are nothing like American-made elevators in a democracy

utterances.speaker: THE REV. FRANKLIN GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We are just a few floors, Greta, from our office here in Hanoi. And when we passed about the 24th floor, we all felt kind of a violent shake and then the elevator kind of started going down. It felt like the brake on the cable was holding but we were stuck. And we might be here a while. Well, if it goes down, I'm going up.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. All right. ...Jump through there, quickly.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.sentences: Do you mind if I use the stairs?  Yes, all is well that ends well. But I confess that was not fun. It was about 10 or 15 minutes, and I'm so glad to be home. There is nothing like American-made elevators in a democracy. I love them.   And that's my "Off the Record" comment tonight.

utterances.speaker: THE REV. FRANKLIN GRAHAM
